Package ton.examples_ext

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ExampleDSP01StereoOutput
    this examples demonstrates how to create stereo sounds with DSP.
    ExampleDSP02PassThrough
    this examples demonstrates how to receive audio data from the input device and pass it through to the output device.
    ExampleDSP03Echo
    this examples demonstrates how to implement a basic echo effect in DSP.
    ExampleDSP04LowPassFilter
    this examples demonstrates how to use a *Low-Pass Filter* (LPF) on a sawtooth oscillator in DSP.
    ExampleDSP05Wavetable
    this examples demonstrates how to use a wavetable ( a chunk of memory ) and play it back at different frequencies and amplitudes.
    ExampleDSP06LFO
    this examples demonstrates how to implement a low-frequency oscillator (LFO) by using wavetables to emulate oscillators that affect the amplitude and frequency parameter of an oscillator (VCO).
    ExampleDSP07Sampler
    this examples demonstrates how to use a sampler ( a pre-recorded chunk of memory ) and play it at different speeds and amplitudes.
    ExampleDSP08Trigger
    this examples demonstrates how to use a trigger to convert alternating signals into events ( `trigger` ).
    ExampleDSP09ToneEngineInteralWithDSP  
    ExampleEvent01ReceiveMIDIandOSC
    this examples demonstrates how to receive MIDI and OSC events in the `event_receive` method.
    ExampleEvent02MIDIClock
    this examples shows how to use a beat triggered by an external MIDI beat clock.
    ExampleEvent03MIDIExternalKeyboard
    this examples demonstrates how to parse MIDI events sent from an external MIDI device ( i.e a MIDI keyboard ) and parse the events to play notes with the tone engine.
    ExampleInstruments01ADSR
    this examples shows how to use an instrument with an amplitude envelope ( ADSR ).
    ExampleInstruments02Oscillators
    this examples shows how to use different oscillators in an instrument.
    ExampleInstruments03FrequencyAndAmplitude
    this examples demonstrates how to control the tone engineâ€™s frequency and amplitude directly ( instead of setting it by a note and its velocity ).
    ExampleInstruments04LFOs
    this example demonstrates how to use the built-in low-frequency oscillators (LFOs) to change the sound characteristics of an instrument.
    ExampleInstruments05LPF  
    ExampleInstruments06SixteenVoices  
    ExampleInstruments07OSCToneEngine
    this examples demonstrates how to use the OSC tone engine to send OSC commands.
    ExampleInstruments08PitchBend
    this examples shows how use pitch bending i.e offsetting the note by a fraction of its frequency.
    ExampleSpeechSynthesis
    this examples shows how to use the built in speech synthesis engine ( MacOS only )
    ExampleTechnique01Sequencer
    this examples shows how to use the sequencer to repeatedly play a predefined pattern.
    ExampleTechnique02Arpeggiator
    this examples demonstrates how to use the [arpeggiator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synthesizer#Arpeggiator).
